action.action-desc: Mr. Grayson introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To prohibit students who have been convicted of a criminal hazing offense under State law from receiving assistance under title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965.

section.header: Loss of eligibility for hazing crime conviction
section.text: Section 484 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1091) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Loss of eligibility for hazing crime conviction
subsection.text: No student who is convicted of a criminal hazing offense under State law shall be eligible to receive any grant, loan, or work assistance under this title.
